channel.title: CVE Feed for Moxa -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Moxa -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-39982|2024-09-30T20:16:40.675Z -- moxa -- mxsecurity%20series
item.description: A vulnerability has been identified in MXsecurity versions prior to v1.0.1. The vulnerability may put the confidentiality and integrity of SSH communications at risk on the affected device. This vulnerability is attributed to a hard-coded SSH host key, which might facilitate man-in-the-middle attacks and enable the decryption of SSH traffic.

item.title: CVE-2023-39979|2024-09-30T20:18:16.494Z -- moxa -- mxsecurity%20series
item.description: There is a vulnerability in MXsecurity versions prior to 1.0.1 that can be exploited to bypass authentication. A remote attacker might access the system if the web service authenticator has insufficient random values.

item.title: CVE-2023-39981|2024-09-30T20:17:40.304Z -- moxa -- mxsecurity%20series
item.description: A vulnerability that allows for unauthorized access has been discovered in MXsecurity versions prior to v1.0.1. This vulnerability arises from inadequate authentication measures, potentially leading to the disclosure of device information by a remote attacker.

item.title: CVE-2023-39983|2024-09-30T20:15:47.058Z -- moxa -- mxsecurity%20series
item.description: A vulnerability that poses a potential risk of polluting the MXsecurity sqlite database and the nsm-web UI has been identified in MXsecurity versions prior to v1.0.1. This vulnerability might allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to register or add devices via the nsm-web application.

item.title: CVE-2024-6787|2024-09-23T14:05:59.889Z -- moxa -- mxview%20one%20series
item.description: This vulnerability occurs when an attacker exploits a race condition between the time a file is checked and the time it is used (TOCTOU). By exploiting this race condition, an attacker can write arbitrary files to the system. This could allow the attacker to execute malicious code and potentially cause file losses.

item.title: CVE-2024-6786|2024-09-23T14:05:05.194Z -- moxa -- mxview%20one%20series
item.description: The vulnerability allows an attacker to craft MQTT messages that include relative path traversal sequences, enabling them to read arbitrary files on the system. This could lead to the disclosure of sensitive information, such as configuration files and JWT signing secrets.

item.title: CVE-2024-6785|2024-09-23T14:03:30.646Z -- moxa -- mxview%20one%20series
item.description: The configuration file stores credentials in cleartext. An attacker with local access rights can read or modify the configuration file, potentially resulting in the service being abused due to sensitive information exposure.

item.title: CVE-2024-6785|2024-09-23T01:38:54.833Z -- moxa -- mxview%20one%20series
item.description: The configuration file stores credentials in cleartext. An attacker with local access rights can read or modify the configuration file, potentially resulting in the service being abused due to sensitive information exposure.

item.title: CVE-2024-4641|2024-06-26T17:39:20.742Z -- moxa -- oncell%20g3150a-lte%20series
item.description: OnCell G3470A-LTE Series firmware versions v1.7.7 and prior have been identified as vulnerable due to accepting a format string from an external source as an argument. An attacker could modify an externally controlled format string to cause a memory leak and denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2024-4638|2024-06-26T17:35:59.080Z -- moxa -- oncell%20g3470a-lte%20series
item.description: OnCell G3470A-LTE Series firmware versions v1.7.7 and prior have been identified as vulnerable due to a lack of neutralized inputs in the web key upload function. An attacker could modify the intended commands sent to target functions, which could cause malicious users to execute unauthorized commands.

item.title: CVE-2024-4641|2024-06-25T09:23:30.502Z -- moxa -- oncell%20g3150a-lte%20series
item.description: OnCell G3470A-LTE Series firmware versions v1.7.7 and prior have been identified as vulnerable due to accepting a format string from an external source as an argument. An attacker could modify an externally controlled format string to cause a memory leak and denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2024-4639|2024-06-25T09:15:03.229Z -- moxa -- oncell%20g3150a-lte%20series
item.description: OnCell G3470A-LTE Series firmware versions v1.7.7 and prior have been identified as vulnerable due to a lack of neutralized inputs in IPSec configuration. An attacker could modify the intended commands sent to target functions, which could cause malicious users to execute unauthorized commands.

item.title: CVE-2024-4640|2024-06-25T09:19:08.712Z -- moxa -- oncell%20g3150a-lte%20series
item.description: OnCell G3470A-LTE Series firmware versions v1.7.7 and prior have been identified as vulnerable due to missing bounds checking on buffer operations. An attacker could write past the boundaries of allocated buffer regions in memory, causing a program crash.

item.title: CVE-2024-3576|2024-06-06T19:21:26.228Z -- moxa -- nport%205100a%20series
item.description: The NPort 5100A Series firmware version v1.6 and prior versions are affected by web server XSS vulnerability. The vulnerability is caused by not correctly neutralizing user-controllable input before placing it in output. Malicious users may use the vulnerability to get sensitive information and escalate privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-4638|2024-06-25T08:49:24.910Z -- moxa -- oncell%20g3470a-lte%20series
item.description: OnCell G3470A-LTE Series firmware versions v1.7.7 and prior have been identified as vulnerable due to a lack of neutralized inputs in the web key upload function. An attacker could modify the intended commands sent to target functions, which could cause malicious users to execute unauthorized commands.
